blogPost.excerpt:
(Jan. 6) House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says Congress will resume the Electoral College proceedings once the Capitol is cleared of pro-Donald Trump protesters and safe for use.

Pelosi said she made the decision Wednesday in consultation with the Pentagon, the Justice Department and the vice president, who will preside.

She noted the day would always be â€œpart of history,â€ but now it would be â€œas such a shameful picture of our country was put out into the world.â€

Trump had encouraged his supporters to come to Washington to fight Congressâ€™ formal approval of President-elect Joe Bidenâ€™s win. He held a rally earlier Wednesday and urged his supporters to march to the Capitol, telling them to â€œget rid of the weak Congress peopleâ€ and saying, â€œget the weak ones get out; this is the time for strength.â€

Trump supporters breached the Capitol building and clashed with law enforcement before disrupting Congressâ€™ tallying of the Electoral College votes. Trump has repeatedly told his supporters that the November election was stolen from him, even though that is not true.

Subscribe to our YouTube channel:Â https://bit.ly/2TwO8Gm

blogPost.body:
(Jan. 6) House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says Congress will resume the Electoral College proceedings once the Capitol is cleared of pro-Donald Trump protesters and safe for use.

Pelosi said she made the decision Wednesday in consultation with the Pentagon, the Justice Department and the vice president, who will preside.

She noted the day would always be â€œpart of history,â€ but now it would be â€œas such a shameful picture of our country was put out into the world.â€

Trump had encouraged his supporters to come to Washington to fight Congressâ€™ formal approval of President-elect Joe Bidenâ€™s win. He held a rally earlier Wednesday and urged his supporters to march to the Capitol, telling them to â€œget rid of the weak Congress peopleâ€ and saying, â€œget the weak ones get out; this is the time for strength.â€

Trump supporters breached the Capitol building and clashed with law enforcement before disrupting Congressâ€™ tallying of the Electoral College votes. Trump has repeatedly told his supporters that the November election was stolen from him, even though that is not true.

previous.excerpt:
Police have confirmed that a woman who was shot earlier during the Capitol riots has died due to her injuries.

Earlier today supporters massed outside Congress - and then forced their way in - leading to the suspension of the session which was due to confirm Joe Biden as the next President.

SUBSCRIBE to our YouTube channel for more videos: http://www.youtube.com/skynews
 
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/skynews 
 
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/skynews
 
Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/skynews
 
For more content go to http://news.sky.com and download our apps:

Top stories this morning 0:00

ï»¿ï»¿Joining our rolling coverage of the unprecedented sitiuation in the US on BBC iPlayer ğŸ‘‰ https://bbc.in/2J18jYJ

Here's a roundup of the latest developments:

    Lawmakers are continuing with the certification of Joe Biden's win in the November presidential election after clashes on Capitol Hill during which four people died
    Proceedings were halted when the complex was overrun by a violent group of President Trump's supporters angry at what they considered to be a rigged election
    Washington DC is under curfew and police in riot gear continue to guard the streets
    So far, at least 52 people have been arrested - 47 of them for curfew violations
    Twitter and Facebook have locked President Trump's accounts, preventing him from being able to post 

Follow the story ğŸ‘‰ https://bbc.in/2MIpi7V
